name: Ibuprofen 400mg Capsules
treatmentDescriptions: Ibuprofen is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) used to treat pain, fever, and inflammation. It is effective for headaches, menstrual cramps, arthritis, muscle aches, and dental pain.
termsOfIssue: Available over-the-counter without prescription. Maximum daily dose should not exceed 1200mg for adults. Take with food to minimize stomach upset. Not recommended for children under 6 years.
administrationNotes: Take with food or milk to reduce stomach irritation. Do not crush or chew capsules. Take every 4-6 hours as needed, but not more than 3 times per day. Maximum daily dose: 1200mg for adults.
ingredients: Active ingredient: Ibuprofen 400mg. Inactive ingredients: Lactose monohydrate, maize starch, povidone, sodium starch glycolate, magnesium stearate, and other excipients.
contraindications: Hypersensitivity to ibuprofen or other NSAIDs. Active peptic ulcer disease. Severe heart failure. Third trimester of pregnancy. History of asthma attacks with NSAID use.
sideEffect: Common side effects include stomach upset, heartburn, nausea, and dizziness. May cause stomach ulcers or bleeding with long-term use. Can increase blood pressure and risk of heart attack or stroke.
warnings: Take with food to minimize stomach irritation. Do not use for more than 10 days for pain or 3 days for fever without consulting a doctor. May increase risk of heart attack or stroke, especially with long-term use.

packaging.name: Ibuprofen 400mg Capsules - 30 capsules
packaging.packagingDescription: Red and white capsules in a blister pack, packaged in a cardboard box with patient information leaflet.
packaging.manufacturersAdministrationRecommendatio: Take 1 capsule every 4-6 hours as needed for pain or fever. Do not exceed 3 capsules in 24 hours. Take with food or milk to reduce stomach irritation.
